encounters.description: There is no greater symbol of the Emperor's New Order than the elite stormtroopers legions!

equipment: Blaster rifle (Ranged [Heavy]; Damage 9; Critical 3; Range [Long]; Stun setting)
Vibroknife (Melee; Damage 4; Critical 2; Range [Engaged]; Pierce 2, Vicious 1)
2 frag grenades (Ranged [Light]; Damage 8; Critical 4; Range [Short]; Blast 6, Limited Ammo 1)
Stormtrooper armor (+2 soak)
Utility belt
Extra reloads
Individuals or groups of two may be armed with light repeating blasters with slings (Ranged [Heavy]; Damage 11; Critical 3; Range [Long]; Auto-fire, Cumbersome 4, Pierce 1)
description: There is no greater symbol of the Emperor's New Order than the elite stormtrooper legions that enforce his will without remorse, mercy, or compassion. The featureless helmets, the uniformity of their armor, and the sheer number of them advancing without care for the losses they sustain, all contribute to their intractable image. The details of the Clone Wars have been long forgotten by the majority of the galaxy's denizens. As a result, there are precious few who associate the terrifying modern stormtroopers with the once-heroic clone troopers who waged that conflict on behalf of the Galactic Republic.

The Imperial Stormtrooper Corps is an independent branch of the military, and while they answer to the officers of both the Army and the Navy, their own commanders have the discretion to ignore or overrule orders issued to them if they feel they are not in the best interests of the Galactic Empire. There are numerous specialties within the stormtrooper legions, the majority of which use equipment that meshes with their training to create a cadre of elite troops that can effectively serve in virtually any combat theater.

desires.name: Fame
desires.description: Grand Moff Leonis seeks the limelight and wants to be recognized. She will pursue anything that can garner the attention and praise of the Emperor.

fear.name: Failure
fear.description: Most people dislike failure, but Grand Moff Leonis actively fear it. She wants to be the perfect Imperial servant; which sometimes leads her to do nothing instead of a chance of failing.

strength.name: Wise
strength.description: Through years of experience and countless events, Grand Moff Leonis has developed that rare quality: wisdom. The wise understand the truths of how their world works. Just as importantly, they know that sometimes, with the right effort, those truths can be overcome.

flaw.name: Intolerance
flaw.description: Grand Moff Leonis harbors some prejudices toward a group of people. These may be relatively “minor” biases, or they may give rise to an intense emotion of hatred or revulsion. Whatever form it takes, remember that intolerance is based more in emotion than rationality.

talents.name: Adversary 2
talents.effect: Upgrade difficulty of all combat checks against this target twice.

talents.name: Plausible Deniability 4
talents.effect: Remove [SE][SE][SE][SE] from all Coercion or Deception checks

talents.name: Supreme Inspiring Rhetoric 2
talents.effect: As a maneuver, may make an Average ([DI][DI]) Leadership check; each [SU] removes 1 strain or wound from one ally in short range; spend [AD] to remove 1 additional strain or wound from an affected ally; all affected allies add [BO][BO] to all checks for 4 rounds.

abilities.name: Imperial Valor
abilities.effect: May perform a maneuver to cause all ranged attacks targeting the Grand Moff to instead hit one ally or helpless enemy he is engaged with, until the beginning of his next turn.

equipment: Blaster pistol (Ranged [Light]; Damage 6; Critical 3; Range [Medium]; Stun setting)
description: Grand Moff Leeadra Leonis overlook a critical priority sector consisting of almost 20 sectors and commands formidable forces aided by Grand Admiral Barret Marh and Grand General Lance Sleater.

talents.name: Adversary 3
talents.effect: Upgrade difficulty of all combat checks against this target three time.

talents.name: Command 3
talents.effect: Add [BO][BO][BO] to Leadership checks; affected targets add [BO][BO][BO] to Discipline checks for the next 24 hours.

talents.name: Commanding Presence 2
talents.effect: Remove [SE][SE] from all Leadership checks.

talents.name: Field Commander
talents.effect: As an action, may make an Average ([DI][DI]) Leadership check; 4 allies may immediately suffer 1 strain to perform a free maneuver.

abilities.name: Space Supremacy
abilities.effect: May perform a maneuver to direct an Imperial Navy minion group within medium range; the group may perform an immediate free maneuver or add [BO][BO] to its next check.

abilities.name: Overwhelming Fire
abilities.effect: May perform a maneuver to direct an Imperial Navy minion group within medium range; the group may perform an immediate free combat check action.

equipment: Blaster pistol (Ranged [Light]; Damage 6; Critical 3; Range [Medium]; Stun setting)
description: Grand Admiral Barret Marh is actively seeking to eliminate the rebel threat, once and for all! And, under the command of Grand Moff Leonis, on board the Imperial Super Star Destroyer "The Liberator", he does a great job at it!
gm-description: Grand Admiral Barret Marh is the nemesis of Admiral Zryv'yhx.

desires.name: Safety
desires.description: Grand Admiral Marh values peace and comfort above all else. He seeks to eliminate the rebel threat, once and for all!

fear.name: Nemesis
fear.description: An old rival of Grand Admiral Marh, back at the academy, is now part of the Rebel Alliance: Zryv'yhx, an Arkanian. Marh failed to keep him from destroying 2 Imperial Star Destroyers before fleeing with a little band of rebels due to his cunning sense and his superior knowledge. Since then, Marh fears the day he will need to meat Zryv'yhx again.

strength.name: Curious
strength.description: Life is a million mysteries, and Marh wants to learn about every one. This is probably the principal reason why he joined the navy!

flaw.name: Laziness
flaw.description: Grand Admiral Marh always seeks the path of least resistance and can becomes intimidated by difficult or complex tasks.

description: Foxwell ranked up from Commander to Colonel, after the destruction of the rebel base that was hidden in the Lanexa-Bunn Mine.

talents.name: Adversary 2
talents.effect: Upgrade difficulty of all combat checks against this target twice.

talents.name: Command 2
talents.effect: Add [BO][BO] to Leadership checks; affected targets add [BO][BO] to Discipline checks for the next 24 hours.

talents.name: Field Commander
talents.effect: As an action, may make an Average ([DI][DI]) Leadership check; 4 allies may immediately suffer 1 strain to perform a free maneuver.

abilities.name: COMPNOR Dedication
abilities.effect: May perform a maneuver to direct a COMPNOR agent within short range; the agent may suffer 1 strain to perform an immediate free combat check action.

equipment: Blaster pistol (Ranged [Light]; Damage 6; Critical 3; Range [Medium]; Stun setting)
Vibroknife (Melee; Damage 4; Critical 2; Range [Engaged]; Pierce 2, Vicious 1)
(optional) Blaster carbine (Ranged [Heavy]; Damage 9; Critical 3; Range [Medium]; Stun setting)
Armored clothing (+ 1 defense, +1 soak)
description: Carter Foxwell is a respected Imperial Security Bureau Commander. He is the PCs overseer.
Foxwell has a missing leg that has been replaced by a cybernetic implant. This is due to some mission.

desires.name: Vengeance
desires.description: A rebel cruiser crashed on his natal planet of X and killed his parents. On that day, eight years old Foxwell sworn to exact revenge against the Rebel Alliance.

fear.name: Obscurity
fear.description: For all the sacrifice Commander Foxwell made for the New Order (including his leg), he wishes to be remembered as a true patriot in honor of his family. To achieve that goal, he works tirelessly.

strength.name: Idealistic
strength.description: Commander Foxwell knows that the New Order is the only way to move forward! Those who wrong him on this tend to disappear.

flaw.name: Anger
flaw.description: After getting his cybernetic leg, Foxwell lost the only bit of patience that was left in him. He now frequently lashes out at his subordinate with extreme force and he overreacts very often.

description: Grand General Lance Sleater is a courageous man, serving under Grand Moff Leonis for many years, and leads the Priority Sectors' forces against the Rebel Alliance with pride!

desires.name: Wealth
desires.description: Money and material possessions are the prime goals of Grand General Sleater. Grand General Sleater's family owns many businesses, and he will do many things to divert funds toward those companies (that he also own shares in).

fear.name: Change
fear.description: Grand General Sleater finds routine and stability comforting, and fears changes that could upend his day-to-day routine.

strength.name: Courageous
strength.description: Fear has no place in Grand General Sleater's heart. He laughs at danger and gladly push himself and the men under his command to confront what others flee from.

flaw.name: Pride
flaw.description: Grand General Sleater is arrogant and thinks highly of himself; often at the expense of the others.

description: If the PCs are making too much noize about the investigation, Baltzell will begin to not like that and will try to shut the operation down; claiming that his cruiser was safe for years and will continue to be so under his exemplary command!
Commodore Baltzell is an old loyal officer of the New Order. He fought during the clone wars when he was only a young officer.

The Navy is his life and he do not want to retire; but he prefers easier missions nowaday. That's why he got in charge of the first Assimilator-Class Interdictor Star Destroyer: the Destiny. The Emperor himself presided the ceremony.

desires.name: Fame
desires.description: Your character seeks the limelight and wants to be famous. They pursue anything that can garner attention and praise.

fear.name: Change
fear.description: Your character finds routine and stability comforting, and fears changes that could upend their day-to-day routine.

strength.name: Courageous
strength.description: Fear has no place in your character’s heart. They laugh at danger and gladly push themself to confront what others flee from. Note that your character probably still has a Fear Motivation. It’s up to you whether that Fear is the one thing that can undo your character’s courage, or if this Strength pushes them to confront the source of their Fear no matter what.

flaw.name: Compulsion
flaw.description: Commodore Baltzell is obsessed by his look; everything must be clean, his uniform perfect, etc. He (too) often replace his uniform, or try to clean it up (even when clean), etc. This is probably anoying to others, but he is most of the time the boss, so...

description: Zryv'yhx is a Rebel Alliance Admiral...
gm-description: Zryv'yhx is the nemesis of Grand Admiral Barret Marh

desires.name: Safety
desires.description: Zryv'yhx values peace and comfort above all else. He wants to restore peace to the galaxy by getting rid of the evil Galactic Empire!

fear.name: Nemesis
fear.description: Admiral Zryv'yhx fears the next time he will have to encounter an old rival: Grand Admiral Marh. Back at the imperial academy, Marh failed to keep him from destroying 2 Imperial Star Destroyers before fleeing with a group of freedom fighters. Now Marh is a Grand Admiral!

strength.name: Idealistic
strength.description: Zryv'yhx believes in the Rebel Alliance and the freedom that it can get to the galaxy. Zryv'yhx feels like everyone should live up to his ideals and is disappointed when people don’t.

flaw.name: Deception
flaw.description: Zryv'yhx will become disloyal to those who do not adhere to his idealistic view of the galaxy, or anyone not agreeing with him for that matter. He does not fear to use coercion to help his cause; on both allies and enemies. Zryv'yhx is concerned with his wellbeing first and foremost, and he always presents himself in the best possible light even when that isn’t the case.

description: Zryv'yhx was killed at the battle of the the Lanexa-Bunn Mine. His Mon Calamari Cruiser, the Caterpillar, crashed on the planet after getting cut in half by the concentrated fire of both the Super Star Destroyer Liberator and the Imperial Star Destroyer Avalanche, leading to a magnificent meteor shower.
Tarrance was a mechanics on board the Assimilator-Class Interdictor Star Destroyer Destiny.
Tarrance looks like he slept in a sublight engine and some unknown substances stain his uniform. He his clearly not heading to a parade.
He wears a toolbelt and has, most of the time, some kind of diagnostic tools in his hand.
gm-description: Tarrance is a hell of a mechanic, but he hears nothing and knows nothing; besides how to keep a capital ship flying!

desires.name: Vengeance
desires.description: Someone or something wronged your character in the past, and the character has sworn to exact revenge against the aggrieving party.

fear.name: Failure
fear.description: Most people dislike failure, but some actively fear it. That fear may drive them to try to become absolutely perfect, or it may crush them into inaction. Maybe it does both.

strength.name: Adaptable
strength.description: No matter what life throws at your character, they always rise to the challenge. Your character is flexible and can handle nearly every situation, no matter how grim or strange the circumstances.

flaw.name: Ignorance
flaw.description: Your character lacks a basic knowledge base or understanding of a society’s norms. This may be due to your character’s upbringing or their recent travel to another area of the world. This could be more than just being “uneducated”; at some level, your character may be willfully ignorant.

description: Corry Stocks was the officer that welcomed the PCs on board the Assimilator-Class Interdictor Star Destroyer Destiny, and served as their liaison officer.

Standing 5' 9" tall, Lieutenant Corry Stocks is an olive-skinned woman that has a sweet and innocent feel about her. She has a narrow face with a small nose, small ears, rosy cheeks, and puffy lips. Her blue eyes are wide, she has tapered eyebrows, and long braided blonde hairs. She has toned arms, sexy curves, and long legs.

desires.name: Love
desires.description: She seeks romantic affection and intimacy from [some offier] and she strive to be loved by him. But just being loved or charmed could also do, for a while.

fear.name: Isolation
fear.description: She fears being isolated from other people and being doomed to live and die alone. That's what drives her to seek out relationships with anyone and everyone, even when a relationship is unpleasant or unhealthy.

strength.name: Adaptable
strength.description: No matter what life throws at your character, they always rise to the challenge. Your character is flexible and can handle nearly every situation, no matter how grim or strange the circumstances.

flaw.name: Deception
flaw.description: She is concerned with her own wellbeing first and foremost, and she always present herself in the best possible light even when that isn’t the case.

description: Bad ass killer pirate captain!
gm-description: Their base name is the Atoll of the Unnamed. The planet is very watery. The base entrance is coral rim that completely encircles a lagoon; with a force field that get the water outside, if you don't know, it looks like a normal lagoon. When entering the base, it feels like crashing in the water!

desires.name: Fame
desires.description: Your character seeks the limelight and wants to be famous. They pursue anything that can garner attention and praise.

fear.name: Commitment
fear.description: The idea of making promises or being relied on scares your character, who hates the idea that someone else is relying on them. This fear of commitment could manifest in relationships, on the job, or among family.

strength.name: Adaptable
strength.description: No matter what life throws at your character, they always rise to the challenge. Your character is flexible and can handle nearly every situation, no matter how grim or strange the circumstances.

flaw.name: Deception
flaw.description: Your character may be disloyal or a compulsive liar. They are concerned with their own wellbeing first and foremost, and they might always present themselves in the best possible light even when that isn’t the case.

description: Claudette “Mauve” Malasky, called M&M, is the captain and pilot of the Scalvenker!
The Scalvenker's crew is part of Captain Naarlock's pirates band.

strength.name: Analytical
strength.description: Your character’s mind is like a computer, able to absorb a barrage of information and come to a logical conclusion. Your solutions always have the inarguable weight of reason, and you know how to pick your battles and when to bide your time.

flaw.name: Intolerance
flaw.description: She is highly intolerance against all political groups like the Empire or the Rebel Alliance.

description: Hugo the Hatless is a crew member of the Scalvenker (Cannoneers).

strength.name: Spiritual
strength.description: Hugo the Hatless believes in Naarlock. His belief gives him a solid mental bedrock he can always rely on.

flaw.name: Pride
flaw.description: Hugo the Hatless is arrogant, vain, self-absorbed, and thinks highly of himself at the expense of others. He also feel indestructible, due to his believes.

description: Elanor “Bones” is a crew member of the Scalvenker (Cannoneers).

strength.name: Idealistic
strength.description: Elanor “Bones” believes in the Naarlock pirate's code; Pirates for life!; those ideals are nothing short of sacred. Bones feels that everyone should live up to the pirate code and she gets disappointed with people that don’t.

flaw.name: Recklessness
flaw.description: Elanor “Bones” shows little regard for how their actions may affect herself or others, as long as she follows her ideals. She is prone to dangerous and inconsiderate actions.

equipment: Blaster Rifle (Ranged [Heavy]; Damage: 9; Critical: 3; Range [Long]; Stun Setting)
Vibroknife (Melee; Damage 3; Critical 2; Range [Engaged]; Pierce 2, Vicious 1)
Padded Armor (+2 soak)
description: Captain Naarlock's pirates swarm!

talents.name: Quick Draw
talents.effect: May draw or holster a weapon as an incidental.

talents.name: TODO
talents.effect: Find another one; maybe something like a flamethrower attack or something else badass...

equipment: DX-2 Disruptor* Pistol (Ranged [Light]; Damage 10; Critical 2; Range [Short]; Vicious 4)
Vibroknife (Melee; Damage 3; Critical 2; Range [Engaged]; Pierce 2, Vicious 1)
Pirate Commando Armor (+2 soak, +1 defense)
Utility belt
**Disruptor**: Whenever a victim is hit by a disruptor, any Critical Hit results in a "Crippled" effect unless the roll would result in an even more grievous injury.
description: Captain Naarlock's pirates commandos!

abilities.name: Coercive Dissuasion
abilities.effect: Once per encounter, roll an hard (???) Coercion (BR) check. If successful, have the enemies of the Incinerator, with a line of sight, roll an average (??) fear check. Use [AD] to add a [SE], use [TH] to add a [BO], use [AD][AD][AD] to upgrade the difficulty once, use [TH][TH][TH] to downgrade the difficulty once, [TR] to upgrade the difficulty twice, or [DE] to downgrade difficulty twice.

equipment: CZ-28 Flamestrike (Gunnery; Damage 9; Critical 2; Range [Short]; Burn 3; Blast 9; Cumbersome 3; Vicious 2; Two-Handed)
Vibroknife (Melee; Damage 5; Critical 2; Range [Engaged]; Pierce 2, Vicious 1)
Pirate Commando Armor (+2 soak, +1 defense)
Utility belt
description: A big guy with a frightening flamethrower!

desires.name: Justice
desires.description: Your character believes in a set of ethics that demands fair treatment for all. Your character is dedicated to righting inequality and protecting others’ rights.

fear.name: Failure
fear.description: Most people dislike failure, but some actively fear it. That fear may drive them to try to become absolutely perfect, or it may crush them into inaction. Maybe it does both.

strength.name: Curious
strength.description: Life is a million mysteries, and your character wants to learn about every one. Whether curiosity drives them to meet new people, explore distant locales, or learn fantastic new truths and ideas is up to you.

flaw.name: Compulsion
flaw.description: This could be addiction, fascination, obsession, or another automatic behavior that is self-destructive or otherwise impedes your character’s ability to function and be healthy.

talents.name: Adversary 2
talents.effect: Upgrade difficulty of all combat checks against this target twice.

talents.name: Feral Strength 4
talents.effect: +4 damage on all Brawl and Melee attacks.

talents.name: Knockdown
talents.effect: May spend [TR] to knock target prone with successful melee or ranged attack.

talents.name: Dynamic Fire
talents.effect: When making a ranged attack while engaged with an opponent, may suffer 2 strain to reduce the ranged modifier by 1.

talents.name: Point Blank 3
talents.effect: Add 3 damage while using Ranged (Heavy) or Ranged (Light) skills at short range or engaged

abilities.name: Pirate Leader
abilities.effect: May perform a maneuver to give orders to other pirate allies in medium range, granting them [BO] on their next check.

abilities.name: Ghosting
abilities.effect: The Ghost can use a story point to become engaged with an enemy, consuming a maneuver. Ghost 'speed move' toward his enemy to then 'appear' right next to it, ready to attack! Must be narratively possible to execute, must see his target or know his exact position.

abilities.name: Swipe 1
abilities.effect: Spend [AD] during melee combat to cause an engaged opponent to suffer 1 strain

equipment: Ghost's Heavy Blaster Rifle (Ranged [Heavy]; Damage 12; Critical 2; Range [Long]; Auto-fire, Cumbersome 4, Sunder)
Ghost's Vibro-ax (Melee; Damage 11; Critical 1; Range [Engaged]; Pierce 2, Sunder, Vicious 3)

Ghost's Pirate Armor (+2 soak, +1 defense; Personal Stealth/Phaser Generator [Upgrade detection check twice when stealth; Upgrade difficulty of all combat checks against this target once]; Sound suppressor [Add [BO] to Stealth checks])
Utility belt
Sunder: [AD] to activate, can be triggered even if the attack missed; see Genesys Core p.88-89
description: Briggs Hatzenbuhler also known as « The Ghost », is one of the high ranking members of the Naarlock's pirate crew. He is reknown to pack a punch!
He got his nickname due to his stealthy nature, or because he doesn't speak much, or both. Nevertheless, he is not someone to reckon with.

strength.name: Courageous
strength.description: Fear has no place in your character’s heart. They laugh at danger and gladly push themself to confront what others flee from. Note that your character probably still has a Fear Motivation. It’s up to you whether that Fear is the one thing that can undo your character’s courage, or if this Strength pushes them to confront the source of their Fear no matter what.

flaw.name: Timid
flaw.description: Your character is extremely risk averse, opting instead to take more thorough or tried-and-true approaches. They may take too long to act or may be unable to act at all in the face of new or intimidating challenges.

description: Commodore Carbonneau is the officer in charge of the ISD Falsifier, coming to rescue the PCs from pirate captain Naarlock! Agent Undrake called Commodore Carbonneau following their incapacity to contain the Naarlock threat themselves.
Inspector General Guthrie is the internal affaire ISB agent responsible of the Destiny and he will collaborate with any other ISB agent at 200%.
gm-description: He gives the PCs way too much information to be useful. Every officer's "wrong" move, in its presence, has been tracked and documented, even the most insignificant details!
He believes that most officers should be re-educated! Well, more like most Imperial citizen... he his a little intense.

strength.name: Idealistic
strength.description: The COMPNOR is all! Everyone must follow the rules dictated by the Emperor or suffer the consequences!

flaw.name: Greed
flaw.description: Inspector General Guthrie is never satisfied with what he has and he is willing to infringe upon others’ rights in order to get what he wants.

gm-description: Squires is a great computer engineer, but with people, not so much; she take pauses when she talk and mixup words.

strength.name: Analytical
strength.description: Squires’s mind is like a computer, able to absorb a barrage of information and come to a logical conclusion. Her solutions always have the inarguable weight of reason, and she knows how to pick her battles and when to bide her time.

flaw.name: Pride
flaw.description: Squires is so proude of her work, that she quickly become self-absorbed and talk to others like they should know all of that stuff, sometime at their expense. And there goes her social life!

strength.name: Spiritual
strength.description: It doesn’t matter so much what your character believes in: that depends a lot on your game’s setting. What’s important is that your character believes. Their belief gives them a solid mental bedrock they can always rely on.

flaw.name: Recklessness
flaw.description: Your character shows little regard for how their actions may affect themself or others, due either to low selfesteem or lack of forethought. They are especially prone to dangerous or inconsiderate actions.

description: [https://www.pinterest.ca/pin/704883779157553494/](https://www.pinterest.ca/pin/704883779157553494/)
[https://www.pinterest.ca/pin/774408098400278375/](https://www.pinterest.ca/pin/774408098400278375/)

desires.name: Justice
desires.description: Commander Gorr want to restore the galactic republic at all cost!

fear.name: Stability
fear.description: Commander Gorr prefer to be in the flow of the action than stable somewhere safe. For him, stability is so boring that it becomes debilitating.

strength.name: Courageous
strength.description: Fear has no place in your Commander Gorr's heart. He laugh at danger and gladly push himself to confront what others flee from.

flaw.name: Recklessness
flaw.description: Commander Gorr shows little regard for how their actions may affect himself or others, and is especially prone to dangerous or inconsiderate actions. Even suicidal actions!

talents.name: Adversary 2
talents.effect: Upgrade difficulty of all combat checks against this target twice.

talents.name: Command 2
talents.effect: Add [BO][BO] to Leadership checks; affected targets add [BO][BO] to Discipline checks for the next 24 hours.

abilities.name: Leader
abilities.effect: All subordinates within medium range add [BO] to all Discipline checks

abilities.name: Tactical Direction
abilities.effect: May spend a maneuver to direct one minion group within medium range. The group may make an immediate free maneuver or adds one Boost die [BO] to its next check

abilities.name: Overwhelming Fire
abilities.effect: May perform a maneuver to direct one minion group within medium range. The group may perform an immediate free combat check action.

equipment: Blaster Carabine (Ranged [Heavy]; Damage: 9; Critical: 3; Range [Medium]; Stun Setting)
Blaster pistol (Ranged [Light]; Damage 6; Critical 3; Range [Medium]; Stun setting)
Blast Vest (+1 Soak)
Comlink

description: Captain of the Nebulon-B Frigates Kryptoria.
Travus Karns.personality_description: Obsequious: obedient or attentive to an excessive or servile degree.

strength.name: Adaptable
strength.description: No matter what life throws at your character, they always rise to the challenge. Your character is flexible and can handle nearly every situation, no matter how grim or strange the circumstances.

flaw.name: Pride
flaw.description: Pride does not always have to be a Flaw, but it can easily become one. Your character is arrogant, vain, or self-absorbed, or thinks highly of themself at the expense of others.

description: Ashton Mccausland was the captain of the Nebulon-B Frigate Sparta, when it was disabled by the rebels at the battle of the Niyrius system.
He was then given the command of the ISD Herald of Sorrow and assisted at the battle of the Galactic Race.

strength.name: Curious
strength.description: Life is a million mysteries, and your character wants to learn about every one. Whether curiosity drives them to meet new people, explore distant locales, or learn fantastic new truths and ideas is up to you.

flaw.name: Timid
flaw.description: Your character is extremely risk averse, opting instead to take more thorough or tried-and-true approaches. They may take too long to act or may be unable to act at all in the face of new or intimidating challenges.

description: Rostock ranked up from Commander to Commodore, after the destruction of the rebel base that was hidden in the Lanexa-Bunn Mine.
Commodore Rostock is the Imperial Intelligence's equivalent to Colonel Foxwell and she loves to make the ISB looks bad.

desires.name: Vengeance
desires.description: Some ISB agent wronged Rostock in the past and the ISB stood by encouraging him/her, and she sworn to exact revenge against the ISB by diminishing them every time that she can.

fear.name: Expression
fear.description: TBD: Your character has some behavior or means of expressing themself privately that they do not want the world to know about. The nature of that behavior is up to you. Keep the setting in mind when you come up with it, though.

strength.name: Adaptable
strength.description: No matter what life throws at Rostock, she always rise to the challenge. Rostock is flexible and can handle nearly every situation, no matter how grim or strange the circumstances.

flaw.name: Compulsion
flaw.description: TBD: This could be addiction, fascination, obsession, or another automatic behavior that is self-destructive or otherwise impedes your character’s ability to function and be healthy.

description: Juno Eclipse was a Human female officer and pilot in the Alliance to Restore the Republic. Prior to her service in the Alliance Fleet, Eclipse served in the naval forces of the Galactic Empire. A graduate of the Imperial Academy on Corulag, her homeworld, she ultimately attained the rank of Captain after making a name for herself as an exceptionally skilled TIE pilot.

At the height of her military career, the young Imperial officer was personally chosen by Darth Vader to lead the Black Eight Squadron. Although she was initially honored to serve under Vader's command, Eclipse was disturbed by the Sith Lord's tactics which she considered excessively brutal.

Inspired by Galen Marek's sacrifice, Juno Eclipse stayed with the newly formed Rebel Alliance. To ensure that Marek's death would not be in vain, Eclipse dedicated her life to serving in the Alliance's Rebel Fleet, becoming an officer in its ranks and retaining the rank of captain that she previously earned in the Imperial Navy.

desires.name: Vengeance
desires.description: The Empire wronged Juno by forcing her to kill the innocents, and she has sworn to exact revenge against them by joining the Rebel Alliance.

strength.name: Adaptable
strength.description: No matter what life throws at your character, they always rise to the challenge. Your character is flexible and can handle nearly every situation, no matter how grim or strange the circumstances.

flaw.name: Recklessness
flaw.description: Your character shows little regard for how their actions may affect themself or others, due either to low selfesteem or lack of forethought. They are especially prone to dangerous or inconsiderate actions.

description: Raymond, also known as Raymond L'impitoyable, was a pirate smuggler in the Captain Naarlock organization; he deserted when Dargon Starlight recruited him. He is now an employee of Starlight Industries, doing Dargon's biddings.
More TBD...

talents.name: Adversary 1
talents.effect: Upgrade difficulty of all combat checks against this target once.

talents.name: Skilled Jockey 2
talents.effect: Remove [SE][SE] from all Piloting checks.

equipment: Blaster pistol (Ranged [Light]; Damage 6; Critical 3; Range [Medium]; Stun setting)
Blaster rifle (Ranged [Heavy]; Damage 9; Critical 3; Range [Long]; Stun setting)
Vibrosword (Melee; Damage +2[4]; Critical 2; Range [Engaged]; Pierce 2, Vicious 1, Defensive 1)
Blast Vest (+1 Soak)

description: Captain of the Vigial-class corvette Kaki Usyk, under the command of the PCs.

desires.name: Fame
desires.description: Your character seeks the limelight and wants to be famous. They pursue anything that can garner attention and praise.

fear.name: Humiliation
fear.description: Characters who are especially concerned with how others view them are particularly sensitive to potential humiliation. They go out of their way to avoid ever appearing wrong or foolish, even if that means missing out on exciting opportunities and experiences.

strength.name: Curious
strength.description: Life is a million mysteries, and your character wants to learn about every one. Whether curiosity drives them to meet new people, explore distant locales, or learn fantastic new truths and ideas is up to you.

flaw.name: Laziness
flaw.description: Your character always seeks the path of least resistance and becomes intimidated by difficult or complex tasks.

equipment: Blaster pistol (Ranged [Light]; Damage 6; Critical 3; Range [Medium]; Stun setting)
Datapad

description: Blinnmâtoe-Stiwruq is the administrator of Utopia; the cube-shaped pleasure station.

talents.name: Adversary 1
talents.effect: Upgrade difficulty of all combat checks against this target once.

talents.name: Enduring
talents.effect: +1 Soak

talents.name: Nobody's Fool 1
talents.effect: Upgrade difficulty of all Charm, Coercion, and Decep-tion checks targeting Sera Riggers

equipment: Comlink
Datapad
Robes (+1 soak)

description: Ephrem Frystak was an imperial cadet that got kicked out of the academy for being Absent-minded. He then joined the Ancillary corp and became a notorious Waiter, attending important events and serving important people, like Grand Moff Leonis and Cie during the Episode 8: The Galactic Race.
Ephrem knew Kaine at the academy and is always ready to help him out!
gm-description: Ephrem is a contact of Kaine (made by using his "contact talent").

strength.name: Witty
strength.description: Your character is extremely clever, with the right joke for a friend and the perfect insult for a foe. Some may love their company, while others loathe their cutting remarks, but none can deny that your character has the sharpest tongue around.

flaw.name: Compulsion
flaw.description: This could be addiction, fascination, obsession, or another automatic behavior that is self-destructive or otherwise impedes your character’s ability to function and be healthy.

desires.name: Love
desires.description: Your character seeks romantic affection and intimacy from another character. Your character might already have a true love or may strive to find someone to love and be loved by.

fear.name: Obscurity
fear.description: Your character wishes to be remembered after they are gone and works tirelessly to secure their legacy.

strength.name: Patient
strength.description: Your character is always willing to wait and knows the power of being calm. By waiting for the right opportunity, your character avoids all manner of unpleasant and dangerous situations. However, when such an opportunity presents itself, your character acts swiftly and decisively.

flaw.name: Ignorance
flaw.description: Your character lacks a basic knowledge base or understanding of a society’s norms. This may be due to your character’s upbringing or their recent travel to another area of the world. This could be more than just being “uneducated”; at some level, your character may be willfully ignorant.

description: Olav Heglund is a seasoned sniper and one loyal member of rebel Commander Fitz Gorr's inner circle.

talents.name: Adversary 1
talents.effect: Upgrade difficulty of all combat checks against this target once.

talents.name: Dynamic Fire
talents.effect: When making a ranged attack while engaged with an opponent, may suffer 2 strain to reduce the ranged modifier by 1.

talents.name: Point Blank 3
talents.effect: Add 3 damage while using Ranged (Heavy) or Ranged (Light) skills at short range or engaged

talents.name: Deadeye
talents.effect: After your character inflicts a Critical Injury with a ranged weapon and rolls the result, your character may suffer 2 strain to use this talent. Then, you may select any Critical Injury of the same severity to apply to the target instead.

talents.name: Precise Aim
talents.effect: Once per round on the character’s turn, when the character performs an Aim maneuver before attempting a combat check, may suffer a number of strain. The number of strain cannot exceed his ranks in Precise Aim. He then decreases the target’s defense (ranged and melee) by one per strain suffered for that combat check.

abilities.name: Sniper Eyes
abilities.effect: Increase your weapon’s range by one range band (to a maximum of extreme range) when using any Ranged (Heavy) weapon.

abilities.name: Trained Killer
abilities.effect: After a successful Ranged (Heavy) check, you can use a Story Point to add the Breach 1 quality to the attack, or increase an existing Breach rating by 1.

equipment: Sniper Armor (+2 soak)
Modified Sniper rifle (Ranged [Heavy]; Damage 11; Critical 2; Range [Long]; Pierce 2; Accurate 1)
Comlink
Vibroknife (Melee; Damage 6; Critical 2; Range [Engaged]; Pierce 2, Vicious 1)

desires.name: Fame
desires.description: Your character seeks the limelight and wants to be famous. They pursue anything that can garner attention and praise.

fear.name: Isolation
fear.description: Your character fears being isolated from other people and being doomed to live and die alone. Maybe this drives them to seek out relationships with anyone and everyone, even when a relationship is unpleasant or unhealthy.

strength.name: Idealistic
strength.description: What ideals your character believes in are up to you, but to your character, those ideals are nothing short of sacred. Your character may feel that everyone should live up to those same ideals (and may be disappointed when people don’t), or they may be content to meet the standards they have set for themself.

flaw.name: Ignorance
flaw.description: Your character lacks a basic knowledge base or understanding of a society’s norms. This may be due to your character’s upbringing or their recent travel to another area of the world. This could be more than just being “uneducated”; at some level, your character may be willfully ignorant.

description: Alexandros Haff is one of the two loyal bodyguards of the rebel Commander Fitz Gorr.

talents.name: Adversary 1
talents.effect: Upgrade difficulty of all combat checks against this target once.

talents.name: Body Guard 2 (Supreme)
talents.effect: Once per round, your character may suffer a number of strain no greater than their ranks in Body Guard to use this talent. Choose a number of engaged characters up to ranks in Resilience, until the end of your character’s next turn, upgrade the difficulty of all combat checks targeting that ally a number of times equal to the strain suffered.

talents.name: Body Guard (Improved)
talents.effect: Once per session, when an ally protected by the Body Guard maneuver suffers a hit, suffer the hit instead.

talents.name: Forgot to Count?
talents.effect: When an opponent makes a ranged combat check, you can spend [TH][TH] from that check to use this talent to cause their weapon to run out of ammo (see page 104), as long as the weapon can normally run out of ammunition.

passiveTalents.name: Armor Master
passiveTalents.effect: When wearing armor, Increase total soak value by 1.

passiveTalents.name: Armor Master (Improved)
passiveTalents.effect: When wearing armor with a soak value of 2 or higher, increase defense by 1.

abilities.name: Shield Projector
abilities.effect: Maneuver to activate or deactivate; while active, gains defense 2 and upgrades the difficulty of all combat attacks targeting the character once, but the character cannot use the Move maneuver.

abilities.name: Shielded
abilities.effect: Require Shield Projector to be active. Once per encounter, make an Average (??) Discipline Check. If successful, your character plus one ally per [SU] within short range behind the shield gains +1 defense for the remainder of the encounter. Effects end if the initial conditions are not meet anymore.

abilities.name: Improved Covering Fire
abilities.effect: When allied minion groups within short range perform the Covering Fire maneuver, they add +2 ranged defense instead.

equipment: Bodyguard Armor (+3 soak)
Blaster rifle (Ranged [Heavy]; Damage 9; Critical 3; Range [Long]; Stun setting)
Comlink
Vibroknife (Melee; Damage 6; Critical 2; Range [Engaged]; Pierce 2, Vicious 1)

strength.name: Idealistic
strength.description: What ideals your character believes in are up to you, but to your character, those ideals are nothing short of sacred. Your character may feel that everyone should live up to those same ideals (and may be disappointed when people don’t), or they may be content to meet the standards they have set for themself.

flaw.name: Timid
flaw.description: Your character is extremely risk averse, opting instead to take more thorough or tried-and-true approaches. They may take too long to act or may be unable to act at all in the face of new or intimidating challenges.

strength.name: Analytical
strength.description: Your character’s mind is like a computer, able to absorb a barrage of information and come to a logical conclusion. Your solutions always have the inarguable weight of reason, and you know how to pick your battles and when to bide your time.

flaw.name: Greed
flaw.description: Your character is never satisfied with what they have, always wanting more. They are willing to flout the law or infringe upon others’ rights in order to get what they want.

strength.name: Wise
strength.description: Through years of experience and countless events, your character has developed that rare quality: wisdom. The wise understand the truths of how their world works. Just as importantly, they know that sometimes, with the right effort, those truths can be overcome.

flaw.name: Compulsion
flaw.description: This could be addiction, fascination, obsession, or another automatic behavior that is self-destructive or otherwise impedes your character’s ability to function and be healthy.

strength.name: Courageous
strength.description: Fear has no place in your character’s heart. They laugh at danger and gladly push themself to confront what others flee from. Note that your character probably still has a Fear Motivation. It’s up to you whether that Fear is the one thing that can undo your character’s courage, or if this Strength pushes them to confront the source of their Fear no matter what.

flaw.name: Deception
flaw.description: Your character may be disloyal or a compulsive liar. They are concerned with their own wellbeing first and foremost, and they might always present themselves in the best possible light even when that isn’t the case.

strength.name: Independent
strength.description: When everyone else has failed or fallen, your character knows they can still count on themself. Your character may get along with others just fine but makes sure not to rely on others. That way, when things go wrong, your character is always prepared to deal with the situation and isn’t waiting for someone else to help.

flaw.name: Recklessness
flaw.description: Your character shows little regard for how their actions may affect themself or others, due either to low selfesteem or lack of forethought. They are especially prone to dangerous or inconsiderate actions.

strength.name: Courageous
strength.description: Fear has no place in your character’s heart. They laugh at danger and gladly push themself to confront what others flee from. Note that your character probably still has a Fear Motivation. It’s up to you whether that Fear is the one thing that can undo your character’s courage, or if this Strength pushes them to confront the source of their Fear no matter what.

flaw.name: Ignorance
flaw.description: Your character lacks a basic knowledge base or understanding of a society’s norms. This may be due to your character’s upbringing or their recent travel to another area of the world. This could be more than just being “uneducated”; at some level, your character may be willfully ignorant.

description: Derek Faweetley discovered so many planets that he just gave them his last name and a number incremented each time he found new planets. Many of the planets that he dis-covered has been renamed but many less important ones still hold their discovery order in their name, making them hard to remember; which is a good thing for scoundrels!

Dorin Millavec was a commander on the Imperial-class Star Destroyer Crucible during the Galactic Civil War. Personally ordered by Darth Vader to oversee and help Nas Ghent in forming the Black Eight Squadron, Millavec, viewing the entire situation as a plot against his promotion prospects, tried to sabotage Ghent's progress.

equipment: Light blaster pistol (Ranged [Light]; Damage 5; Critical 4; Range [Medium]; Stun setting)
Flight suit
description: Prior to the Battle of Yavin, starfighter pilots were already a celebrated group among the ranks of the Alliance. Pilots are often considered arrogant and coddled by High Command. Whether this perception is true or not, most Alliance pilots are extremely confident to the point of being cocky.

equipment: Light blaster pistol (Ranged [Light]; Damage 5; Critical 4; Range [Medium]; Stun setting)
Flight suit
Astromech droid
description: Many pilots who achieve the distinction of ace are hopelessly arrogant and utterly convinced of their own superiority, lending credence to such beliefs. Starfighter aces are the darlings of the Alliance, a tremendous asset in the Galactic Civil War, and all too often, a tremendous annoyance to other members of the Rebellion.

equipment: Blaster pistol (Ranged [Light]; Damage 6; Critical 3; Range [Medium]; Stun setting)
Blast vest and helmet (+1 soak)
description: Often confused with the rank-and-file of the Imperial Army, much to the consternation of both groups, Naval troopers fulfill essentially the same purpose for the Imperial Navy. Standard duties for naval troopers include the supervision of any and all prisoners aboard a vessel, simple guard duty, escort details for important guests, and boarding actions against enemy vessels.

equipment: Light blaster pistol (Ranged [Light]; Damage 5; Critical 4; Range [Medium]; Stun setting)
Flight suit
description: The pilots produced by the Empire's starfighter training programs are head-and-shoulders above any other equivalent force in the galaxy.

equipment: Light blaster pistol (Ranged [Light]; Damage 5; Critical 4; Range [Medium]; Stun setting)
Flight suit
Sensory augmentation package (add [AD] to any Perception checks made by the character).
description: The pilots produced by the Empire's starfighter training programs are head-and-shoulders above any other equivalent force in the galaxy.
The aces, typically squad leaders and seasoned combat veterans, are a match for even the most arrogant Alliance starhghter pilot.

talents.name: Adversary 1
talents.effect: Upgrade difficulty of all combat checks against this target once.

abilities.name: Tactical Direction
abilities.effect: May perform a maneuver to direct one stormtrooper minion group within medium range. The group may perform an immediate free maneuver or add [BO] to its next check.

equipment: Heavy blaster rifle (Ranged (Heavy]; Damage 10; Critical 3; Range [Long]; Auto-fire, Cumbersome 3)
Vibroknife (Melee; Damage 4; Critical 2; Engaged; Pierce 2, Vicious 1)
2 Frag Grenades (Ranged [Light]; Damage 8; Critical 4; Range [Short]; Blast 6, Limited Ammo 1)
Stormtrooper armor (+2 soak)
Utility belt
Extra reloads
description: Stormtroopers who survive engagements with high marks are promoted to the position of sergeant. Typically this involves command of a single squadron.
K4-S Jailor Droid are the main guards on board of the Gaoler.

talents.name: Heightened Awareness
talents.effect: Allies within short range of the character add [BO] to their Perception and Vigilance checks. Allies engaged with him add [BO][BO] instead.

abilities.name: Droid
abilities.effect: Droids do not need to eat, sleep, or breathe, and are unaffected by toxins and poisons.

equipment: Armored Plating (+1 soak; +1 defense)
Built-in blaster pistol (Ranged [Light]; Damage 6; Critical 3; Range (Medium); Stun Setting)
Security Staff (Melee; Damage 4; Critical 2; Range (Engaged); Defensive 1, Disorient 2, Pierce 2)
Snare Launcher (Ranged [Light]; Damage 0; Critical -; Range (Short); Ensnare 5, Limited Ammo 1)
description: K4-S Jailor Droid are a specialized version of the K4 Security Droid aiming at containing prisoneers.
Lieutenant Jandro is the second in command in Jenssar's squadron.

strength.name: Witty
strength.description: Your character is extremely clever, with the right joke for a friend and the perfect insult for a foe. Some may love their company, while others loathe their cutting remarks, but none can deny that your character has the sharpest tongue around.

flaw.name: Anger
flaw.description: Your character lashes out at themself or others with undue cause or with extreme force. They are quick to resort to physical force to solve their problems.

Flight suit
Sensory augmentation package (add [AD] to any Perception checks made by the character).
description: Erl Jandro is the second in command of an imperial TIE squadron, working to become a squad leader himself.

abilities.name: Squadron Leader II
abilities.effect: Can control a minion group and use up to two of them, upgrading a skill check twice (once per turn).

abilities.name: Moral Booster
abilities.effect: Once per encounter, after making a joke, can flip a story point, roll a simple (-) Charm check and heal his wingmans. Each [SU] heals 1 hull threshold, each [AD] heals 1 system strain, and each [TR] can “respawn” a defeated wingman.

description: Second Lieutenant Macmorran is the third in command in Jenssar's squadron.

strength.name: Patient
strength.description: Your character is always willing to wait and knows the power of being calm. By waiting for the right opportunity, your character avoids all manner of unpleasant and dangerous situations. However, when such an opportunity presents itself, your character acts swiftly and decisively.

flaw.name: Timid

description: Emlyn Macmorran is a talented imperial TIE pilot, flying in Erl Jandro's squadron.

abilities.name: Squadron Leader II
abilities.effect: Can control a minion group and use up to two of them, upgrading a skill check twice (once per turn).

abilities.name: Coordinated Assignations
abilities.effect: Upon a successful attack, may spend [AD][AD] or [TR] to apply effects on the target. See [Coordinated Assignations](Coordinated Assignations) for more info.

description: Major Vittorini is the second in command in the Acers squadron, confronting Jenssar's forces.

strength.name: Wise
strength.description: Through years of experience and countless events, your character has developed that rare quality: wisdom. The wise understand the truths of how their world works. Just as importantly, they know that sometimes, with the right effort, those truths can be overcome.

flaw.name: Recklessness
flaw.description: Your character shows little regard for how their actions may affect themself or others, due either to low selfesteem or lack of forethought. They are especially prone to dangerous or inconsiderate actions.

Flight suit
Astromech droid
description: Teodorico Vittorini is the second in command in the Acers squadron.

talents.name: Offensive Driving
talents.effect: Make an opposed Piloting check (max medium range). If successful, roll two criticals and apply on to Vittorini's vehicle and the other to the target's. [TR] can add +20 to one critical result, while [DE] can add +20 to both.

abilities.name: Squadron Leader III
abilities.effect: Can control a minion group and use up to three of them, upgrading a skill check three times (once per turn).

description: Lieutenant Butschek is the leader of the X-Wing filling up for the missing A-Wing in the Acers squadron, confronting Jenssar's forces.

strength.name: Adaptable
strength.description: No matter what life throws at your character, they always rise to the challenge. Your character is flexible and can handle nearly every situation, no matter how grim or strange the circumstances.

flaw.name: Compulsion
flaw.description: This could be addiction, fascination, obsession, or another automatic behavior that is self-destructive or otherwise impedes your character’s ability to function and be healthy.

Flight suit
Astromech droid
description: Lieutenant Butschek leads 4 X-Wing, and aspire to make it to the Acers squadron.

talents.name: Fine Tuning 2
talents.effect: When reducing the amount of system strain a starship or vehicle suffers, reduce it by 2 additional strain.

abilities.name: Squadron Leader III
abilities.effect: Can control a minion group and use up to three of them, upgrading a skill check three times (once per turn).

description: Commander Esterly, a.k.a. _Rush_, is the leader of the Acers, the notorious A-Wing rebel squadron, confronting Jenssar's forces.

Alyssa Rush Esterly.personality_description: Showing disapproval or contempt toward others, especially those considered to belong to a lower social class.

desires.name: Vengeance
desires.description: Someone or something wronged your character in the past, and the character has sworn to exact revenge against the aggrieving party.

fear.name: Humiliation
fear.description: Characters who are especially concerned with how others view them are particularly sensitive to potential humiliation. They go out of their way to avoid ever appearing wrong or foolish, even if that means missing out on exciting opportunities and experiences.

strength.name: Independent
strength.description: When everyone else has failed or fallen, your character knows they can still count on themself. Your character may get along with others just fine but makes sure not to rely on others. That way, when things go wrong, your character is always prepared to deal with the situation and isn’t waiting for someone else to help.

flaw.description: Your character shows little regard for how their actions may affect themself or others, due either to low selfesteem or lack of forethought. They are especially prone to dangerous or inconsiderate actions.

Astromech droid
description: Many pilots who achieve the distinction of ace are hopelessly arrogant and utterly convinced of their own superiority, lending credence to such beliefs. Starfighter aces are the darlings of the Alliance, a tremendous asset in the Galactic Civil War, and all too often, a tremendous annoyance to other members of the Rebellion.

talents.name: Barrel Roll
talents.effect: When your vehicle suffers a hit, suffer 3 system strain to reduce the damage by Piloting.

talents.name: Master Pilot
talents.effect: Once per round, may suffer 2 strain to perform any action as a maneuver.

talents.name: Tricky Target
talents.effect: Count starship as having a silhouette 1 lower when being attacked.

abilities.name: Squadron Leader III
abilities.effect: Can control a minion group and use up to three of them, upgrading a skill check three times (once per turn).

abilities.name: Superhuman Reflexes
abilities.effect: After generating [DE] on a Piloting check, flip a story point to cancel the [DE] and add [AD] equal to ranks in Cool.

description: **Brew Wilfinger**, aka _Brewinger_, is a crimelord associated to the EdG criminal syndicate.
Bad ass Bounty Hunteress!
Reeda ambushed the PCs in a Goffstown Spaceport hangar bay, leading them to flee.
During his last mission, he made a very bad call which lead to his capture by the rebel alliance.

Director Kataz was the director that sent Undrake to his death before he got recruited by the ISB. Following that incident, Kataz has then been reeducated and demoted to the rank of Deputy Director in charge of second-grade researchers. During his time there, he managed to get some solid research going on toward pioneering subjects, including bending the hyperspace continuum, stealth technologies, and high-end energy recycling for small devices.

Jett loves infiltration and is very good at it; this is one of the main reasons why he is still doing those kinds of missions with his rank. He is one of the best Overwatch infiltrators of the outer rim.
He is warmhearted and friendly, serene of spirit, and always happy and smiling, but constantly overindulges in alcohol.
gm-description: He is often an individualist who works for the law and the good of the greatest number of people, but who may dis-trust higher authority, living and working "outside the law." Includes vigilantes and "Robin Hood" type characters.

Traits:

- Kindly (Average); warmhearted and friendly.
- Peaceful (Obsessive); serene of spirit.
- Cheerful (Strong); always happy and smiling.
- Drunkard (Obsessive); constantly overindulges in alcohol.
Joshua Jett.personality_description: "Each man knows his own 'good' and defends it." sums up the conscientious character's beliefs. He lives according to a strict personal code of ethics.

talents.effect: Your character reduces any Critical Injury result they suffer by 20, to a minimum of 1.

talents.effect: May suffer up to 3 strain to downgrade difficulty of Coercion checks, or upgrade difficulty when targeted by Coercion checks, by an equal number.

talents.name: Knockdown

abilities.name: Devour
abilities.effect: Can spend [TR] to begin to devour a target after a successful attack. The target is ensnared and automatically takes damage at the beginning of the Carbonite Dragon’s turn. A creature that is killed is completely devoured and digested

abilities.name: Tremorsense
abilities.effect: A Carbonite Dragon is able to automatically sense the location of anything that is in contact with the ground within 30 meters

equipment: Massive claws, teeth, and smashing tail (Brawl; Damage 13; Critical 3; Range [Engaged]; Concussive 2, Disorient 2, Pierce 3)
description: At least 50 meters in length, the Carbonite Dragon is an incredibly dangerous foe, making its home in the carbon tunnels of the Lanexa-Bunn II abandoned mines. Their stomachs contain the same Tibanna Crystals, a crystallized type of Carbonite. Those crystals are worth a lot of credits. The only thing the Carbonite Dragon fears is a Greater Carbonite Dragon, and they sometimes clash in titanic struggles when they stray too far into each other’s territory.

talents.name: Adversary 2
talents.effect: Upgrade difficulty of all combat checks against this target twice.

talents.name: Massive 1
talents.effect: When making an attack targeting this creature, the critical rating of any weapons used counts as 1 higher.

talents.name: Durable 3
talents.effect: Your character reduces any Critical Injury result they suffer by 30, to a minimum of 1.

talents.name: Intimidating 4
talents.effect: May suffer up to 4 strain to downgrade difficulty of Coercion checks, or upgrade difficulty when targeted by Coercion checks, by an equal number.

talents.name: Knockdown
talents.effect: Can spend [TR] to knock a target prone after a successful attack

talents.name: Lethal Blows 3
talents.effect: +30% to any Critical Injury rolls made against opponents

passiveTalents.name: Feral Strength 4
passiveTalents.effect: +4 damage on all Brawl and Melee attacks.

abilities.name: Camouflage
abilities.effect: Add [BO][BO] to any Stealth checks made

abilities.name: Devour
abilities.effect: Can spend [TR] to begin to devour a target after a successful attack. The target is ensnared and automatically takes damage at the beginning of the Carbonite Dragon’s turn. A creature that is killed is completely devoured and digested

abilities.name: Tremorsense
abilities.effect: A Carbonite Dragon is able to automatically sense the location of anything that is in contact with the ground within 30 meters

equipment: Massive claws, teeth, and smashing tail (Brawl; Damage 15; Critical 3; Range [Engaged]; Concussive 3, Disorient 3, Breach 2)
description: At least 100 meters in length, the Greater Carbonite Dragon is an enormous underground creature. They look like cave rocks, making them very hard to spot. They can dig tunnels very fast, allowing them to move through rocks. They are rarely seen, but their bones dot the landscape.

talents.name: Adversary 1
talents.effect: Upgrade difficulty of all combat checks against this target once.

talents.name: Durable 1
talents.effect: Your character reduces any Critical Injury result they suffer by 10, to a minimum of 1.

talents.name: Intimidating 1
talents.effect: May suffer up to 1 strain to downgrade difficulty of Coercion checks, or upgrade difficulty when targeted by Coercion checks, by an equal number.

talents.name: Knockdown
talents.effect: Can spend [TR] to knock a target prone after a successful attack

talents.name: Lethal Blows 1
talents.effect: +10% to any Critical Injury rolls made against opponents

passiveTalents.name: Feral Strength 2
passiveTalents.effect: +2 damage on all Brawl and Melee attacks.

abilities.name: Camouflage
abilities.effect: Add [BO][BO] to any Stealth checks made

abilities.name: Call of the pack
abilities.effect: As an incidental, the Minor Carbonite Dragon can call for help. Minor Carbonite Dragons are more likely to answers the call initially, while Carbonite Dragon can come later of the calls for help persist. Greater Carbonite Dragons are not likely to respond.

abilities.name: Tremorsense
abilities.effect: A Carbonite Dragon is able to automatically sense the location of anything that is in contact with the ground within 30 meters

equipment: Massive claws, teeth, and smashing tail (Brawl; Damage 8; Critical 3; Range [Engaged]; Concussive 1, Disorient 1, Pierce 3)
description: At about 20-25 meters in length, the Minor Carbonite Dragon is an dangerous foe, making its home in the carbon tunnels of the Lanexa-Bunn II abandoned mines. They tend to roam around the mine in small groups that stay inside a 30 meters perimeter of one another. Their stomachs contain the same Tibanna Crystals, a crystallized type of Carbonite, but in lesser quantity than their older counterparts.
Agent Futch is a member of the Overwatch division. His team are best know as the Gadgeteers.

strength.name: Witty
strength.description: Your character is extremely clever, with the right joke for a friend and the perfect insult for a foe. Some may love their company, while others loathe their cutting remarks, but none can deny that your character has the sharpest tongue around.

flaw.name: Pride
flaw.description: Pride does not always have to be a Flaw, but it can easily become one. Your character is arrogant, vain, or self-absorbed, or thinks highly of themself at the expense of others.

description: Undrake went to him to aquire 3 Shield Remotes.
Kaine own him a few credit for a lost Sabaac game.
